question: Question_C_03
statement:
Consider the function

\[f(x) = x^2e^{-x}\]

defined on the whole real line.

Find all zeros of $f, f'$ and $f''$ and determine all local minima,
maxima and inflection points of \emph{f}. Sketch the graph of \emph{f}.
You may use the fact that $\lim_{x \to \infty} x^2 e^{-x} = 0$.
